result.execSummary:
All charges against Cloise Allen Crape in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cloise Allen Crape is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cloise Allen Crape

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court by video, defendant Cloise Allen Crape not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss. Court orders case dismissed without prejudice.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape no in court, defendant in custody. Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared  in person by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness not present. State needs more time for state witness to appear in court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nicholas M Weege in court, defendant Cloise Allen Crape not in court, in custody.  
Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Status conference held.  Atty. Weege has just been appointed.  This matter needs a preliminary hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE. Matter to be heard in Br. 29.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST. Case set for Preliminary hearing. Public Defender's office request additional time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with T.V.W; Her children. Her workplace, residence or anywhere she may temporarily occupy.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $12,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cloise Allen Crape in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Cloise Allen Crape in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cloise Allen Crape appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE for Branch 29.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2 and 3.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
